Protocols/PlainFormatProvider.html.abstract: A type that has a default format of plain text

Protocols/XMLFormatProvider.html.name: XMLFormatProvider
Protocols/XMLFormatProvider.html.abstract: A type that has a default format of xml

Protocols/RequestHeaderValue.html.name: RequestHeaderValue
Protocols/RequestHeaderValue.html.abstract: A type that can be used as a value for an HTTP header.

Protocols/URLSessionProvider.html.name: URLSessionProvider
Protocols/URLSessionProvider.html.abstract: A protocol that provides methods for sending URL requests using different mechanisms.

Protocols/RequestPathParameterValue.html.name: RequestPathParameterValue
Protocols/RequestPathParameterValue.html.abstract: A type that can be used as a value for a request path parameter.

Protocols/OptionalType.html.name: OptionalType
Protocols/OptionalType.html.abstract: A type that can be used as a value for a query item.

Protocols/QueryItemValue.html.name: QueryItemValue
Protocols/QueryItemValue.html.abstract: A type that can be used as a value for a query item.

Protocols/Request.html.name: Request
Protocols/Request.html.abstract: Protocol used to define a response type to a given request type.

Protocols/ResponseBodyDecodingStrategy.h.name: ResponseBodyDecodingStrategy
Protocols/ResponseBodyDecodingStrategy.h.abstract: A protocol for defining strategies for handling response bodies.

Protocols/ResponseErrorBodyDecodingStrat.name: ResponseErrorBodyDecodingStrategy
Protocols/ResponseErrorBodyDecodingStrat.abstract: A protocol for defining strategies for handling error response bodies.

Protocols/ResponseHeaderDecodingStrategy.name: ResponseHeaderDecodingStrategy
Protocols/ResponseHeaderDecodingStrategy.abstract: A protocol for defining strategies for decoding response headers.

Extensions/Range.html#/s:Sn6PostieAA14HT.abstract: Checks if a value is within a range of HTTP status codes.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status400.h.name: Status400
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status400.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 400.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status401.h.name: Status401
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status401.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 401.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status403.h.name: Status403
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status403.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 403.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status404.h.name: Status404
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status404.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 404.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status410.h.name: Status410
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status410.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 410.

Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status422.h.name: Status422
Extensions/ResponseErrorBody/Status422.h.abstract: A type alias for ResponseErrorBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 422.

Extensions/ResponseBody/OptionalContent..name: OptionalContent
Extensions/ResponseBody/OptionalContent..abstract: A type alias for ResponseBodyWrapper with an optional content strategy.

Extensions/ResponseBody/Status200.html.name: Status200
Extensions/ResponseBody/Status200.html.abstract: A type alias for ResponseBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 200.

Extensions/ResponseBody/Status201.html.name: Status201
Extensions/ResponseBody/Status201.html.abstract: A type alias for ResponseBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 201.

Extensions/ResponseBody/Status303.html.name: Status303
Extensions/ResponseBody/Status303.html.abstract: A type alias for ResponseBodyWrapper with a status code validation strategy for status code 303.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: continue
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body (in the

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: switchingProtocols
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The requester has asked the server to switch protocols and the server has agreed to do so.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: processing
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: A WebDAV request may contain many sub-requests involving file operations, requiring a long time to complete the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: earlyHints
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Used to return some response headers before final HTTP message.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: ok
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: created
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: accepted
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: nonAuthoritativeInformation
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server is a transforming proxy (e.g.a Web accelerator) that received a 200 OK from its origin, but is returning a

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: noContent
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: resetContent
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server successfully processed the request, asks that the requester reset its document view, and is not returning any content.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: partialContent
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server is delivering only part of the resource (byte serving) due to a range header sent by the client.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: multiStatus
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The message body that follows is by default an XML message and can contain a number of separate response codes,

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: alreadyReported
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The members of a DAV binding have already been enumerated in a preceding part of the (multistatus) response, and are not being included again.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: IMused
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server has fulfilled a request for the resource, and the response is a representation of the result of one or more

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: multipleChoices
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Indicates multiple options for the resource from which the client may choose (via agent-driven content negotiation).

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: movedPermanently
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: found
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Tells the client to look at (browse to) another URL (Previously “Moved temporarily”)

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: seeOther
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The response to the request can be found under another URI using the GET method.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: notModified
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Indicates that the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request headers If-Modified-Since or If-None-Match.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: useProxy
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The requested resource is available only through a proxy, the address for which is provided in the response.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: switchProxy
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: No longer used.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: temporaryRedirect
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: In this case, the request should be repeated with another URI; however, future requests should still use the original URI.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: permanentRedirect
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request and all future requests should be repeated using another URI.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: badRequest
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large,

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: unauthorized
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: paymentRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Reserved for future use.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: forbidden
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: notFound
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: methodNotAllowed
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: A request method is not supported for the requested resource

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: notAcceptable
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: proxyAuthenticationRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: requestTimeout
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server timed out waiting for the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: conflict
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource,

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: gone
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: lengthRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: preconditionFailed
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request header fields.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: payloadTooLarge
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: uriTooLong
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The URI provided was too long for the server to process.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: unsupportedMediaType
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: rangeNotSatisfiable
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The client has asked for a portion of the file (byte serving), but the server cannot supply that portion.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: expectationFailed
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: imATeapot
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: This code was defined in 1998 as one of the traditional IETF April Fools’ jokes, in RFC 2324, Hyper Text Coffee Pot Control Protocol,

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: misdirectedRequest
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response (for example because of connection reuse).

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: unprocessableEntity
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: locked
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The resource that is being accessed is locked.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: failedDependency
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The request failed because it depended on another request and that request failed (e.g., a PROPPATCH).

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: tooEarly
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Indicates that the server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: upgradeRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.3, given in the Upgrade header field.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: preconditionRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: tooManyRequests
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: requestHeaderFieldsTooLarge
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server is unwilling to process the request because either an individual header field, or all the header fields collectively,

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: unavailableForLegalReasons
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: A server operator has received a legal demand to deny access to a resource or to a set of resources that includes the requested resource.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: internalServerError
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: notImplemented
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: badGateway
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: serviceUnavailable
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance).

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: gatewayTimeout
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: httpVersionNotSupported
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: variantAlsoNegotiates
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Transparent content negotiation for the request results in a circular reference.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: insufficientStorage
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: loopDetected
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request (sent instead of 208 Already Reported).

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: notExtended
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: Further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfil it.

Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.name: networkAuthenticationRequired
Enums/HTTPStatusCode.html#/s:6Postie14HT.abstract: The client needs to authenticate to gain network

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: get
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: head
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to that of a GETrequest, but without the response body.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: post
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The POST method is used to submit an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: put
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: connect
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: options
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The OPTIONS method is used to describe the communication options for the target resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: trace
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.name: patch
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:6Postie10HTTPMe.abstract: The PATCH method is used to apply partial modifications to a resource.

Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.name: responseError(statusCode:data:)
Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.abstract: Indicates a response error with a specific status code and data.

Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.name: failedToEncodePlainText(encoding:)
Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.abstract: Indicates a failure to encode plain text with a specific encoding.

Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.name: errorDescription
Enums/APIError.html#/s:6Postie8APIErrorO.abstract: A localized message describing what error occurred.

Enums/APIError.html.name: APIError
Enums/APIError.html.abstract: Represents various errors that can occur when interacting with the API.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: session
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: The URL session provider used for sending requests.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: url
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: The base URL for the API requests.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: pathPrefix
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: An optional path prefix to be appended to the base URL.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Initializes a new instance of HTTPAPIClient with the specified URL, path prefix, and session provider.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:receiveOn:callback:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request using a callback to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:receiveOn:callback:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a JSON body using a callback to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a Form URL Encoded body using a callback to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:receiveOn:callback:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a plain text body using a callback to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request using async-await to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a JSON body using async-await to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a Form URL Encoded body using async-await to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a plain text body using async-await to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request using Combine to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a JSON body using Combine to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a Form URL Encoded body using Combine to handle the response.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.name: send(_:)
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html#/s:6Postie13H.abstract: Sends an HTTP API request with a plain text body using Combine to handle the response.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.name: init(baseURL:)
Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.abstract: Initializes a new instance of RequestEncoder with the specified base URL.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.name: encodeJson(request:)
Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.abstract: Encodes an HTTP request with a JSON body into a URLRequest.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.name: encodeFormURLEncoded(request:)
Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.abstract: Encodes an HTTP request with a Form URL Encoded body into a URLRequest.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.name: encodePlain(request:)
Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.abstract: Encodes an HTTP request with a plain text body into a URLRequest.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.name: encodeXML(request:)
Classes/RequestEncoder.html#/s:6Postie14.abstract: Encodes an HTTP request with an XML body into a URLRequest.

Classes/ResponseDecoder.html#/s:6Postie1.name: decode(_:from:)
Classes/ResponseDecoder.html#/s:6Postie1.abstract: Decodes an HTTP response into the specified type.

Classes/ResponseDecoder.html.name: ResponseDecoder
Classes/ResponseDecoder.html.abstract: A class responsible for decoding HTTP responses into specified types.

Classes/RequestEncoder.html.name: RequestEncoder
Classes/RequestEncoder.html.abstract: A class responsible for encoding HTTP requests into various formats.

Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html.name: HTTPAPIClient
Classes/HTTPAPIClient.html.abstract: A class responsible for sending HTTP API requests and handling responses.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
